By Lisa Shock on Thursday, August 31, 2000 - 12:42 am:

I'm 39
Married
Currently Live In Phoenix, AZ
I'm a vegetarian, science fiction fan and signed up for cryonic suspension. I'm big on personal improvement, and striving for a positive future!
My involvement in cryonics has been of some interest to others; I have been interviewed by BBC Television, Fuji TV, a station in Hong Kong, and U2's Zoo TV which aired as a half hour show on MTV in 1998.
I've been programming computers since 1975, but rarely have done it as a job. I'm a marketing professional in the videogame industry, and I beta test software part-time. I have been a freelance writer since my college days. Assignments have included: restaraunt reviewer, congressional coverage, television commercials, industrial video scripts and screenplays.
I restore old Cadillacs (auto electric is my speciality), and collect items related to the space race.
I'm also a HUGE Trekkie, and I'm listed as a reference in several books about Star Trek. Wired magazine uses me as an occasional Trek related fact-checker.
I act in films whenever the opportunity arises, and can be seen in six so far. I have also acted in the occasional commercial, and done some voice-overs.
Favorite cartoons include Duckman, Ren & Stimpy, Big Guy and Rusty, and Daria.
I am a Blue Blaze Irregular.
I was my college's Postmaster as an undergradutae.
I play a wide variety of games, mostly sims, puzzles, and shooters.
I listen to mostly 'alternative' and punk music, but also have a fondness for modern classical music and the Italian Ars Nova.
I don't have a favorite color, just don't like blue.
I don't have a favorite monster, I enjoy seeing all of the unique traits Tecmo programmed into the game.
